mounted adjective [before noun]
(ON HORSE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
riding a horse, or involving people riding horses: We heard the sound of a galloping horse on the road, and a mounted man challenged us. They asked me to join them on a mounted hunt. mounted police officers
More examplesFewer examplesPolice brought in mounted officers to help control the crowds.Knights on horses charged into battle, ready for mounted combat.After a nasty fall from his horse, it will be months before he is ready for mounted duty again.

mounted adjective [before noun]
(ATTACHED)
Something that is mounted is fixed to a wall, in a frame, etc., so that it can be looked at or used: There's a mounted deer's head above the fireplace. One of the vehicles carried a mounted machine gun.
More examplesFewer examplesFraming a mounted piece of art makes it look so much better.She was presented with a mounted football signed by all the players.
